blog.title: Diaries of a Reylo Shipper
blog.description: Scene/book/fanfic reactions, opinions, and confessions from a self-professed reylo shipper.

summary: I know this is a stretch, but...
body:
I know this is a stretch, but…

With the seeming confirmation of Palpatine’s history of cloning from older materials, and the incredible absence of Hux from the trailer, I got to thinking.

Why was Brendol Hux so uncaring, but dedicated to his son in the canon novels?

Maybe it was because his “son” was actually his mission.

Because maybe Hux is a Palpatine clone…

He would be the right age.

And he looks similar enough…

reblog.comment:

Me: Wtf? I thought this trilogy was about Rey? She’s...
body:

Me: Wtf? I thought this trilogy was about Rey? She’s clearly the protagonist.

summary: are we just not going to talk about how there’s supposedly maybe a big chunk of the death star chilling somewhere? when luke...
body:
are we just not going to talk about how there’s supposedly maybe a big chunk of the death star chilling somewhere? when luke skywalker blew the first one into tiny smithereens? and lando blew the other one into even tinier smithereens?! I saw it with my own eyes, friends. that monster machine blew into dust. but now there’s just a random piece of death star big enough to build a collection of houses in?

I can’t believe they would disrespect rogue one like this. gonna have to bring the whole team back from the dead with palps to fix this. there’s no other solution.

title: Music in EP. IX
body: Is it just me? Or are they playing Han and Leia’s theme in the trailer? Someone correct me if I’m wrong. If it is then I think it kind of points to Ben’s redemption, but I’d certainly love to hear any other thoughts on that matter.

reblog.comment: Is it just me? Or are they playing Han and Leia’s theme in the trailer? Someone correct me if I’m wrong. If it is then I think it kind of points to Ben’s redemption, but I’d certainly love to hear any other thoughts on that matter.

summary: What if Palpatine isn’t the main antagonist in TRS at all? What if his ghost/shade/whatev is there to just provide a clue for...
body: What if Palpatine isn’t the main antagonist in TRS at all? What if his ghost/shade/whatev is there to just provide a clue for Kylo Ren/Ben Solo to Rise Up and perform an incredible Sith feat, say, stop someone he loves from dying? And the true villain is indeed still waiting to be revealed?

title: theory time
body:
If “the Emperor is back” is really going to be a thing we lift from Legends, might as well take a cue from that other Emperor.

Alderaan was sacrificed as part one of a Sith ritual to allow Palpatine’s consciousness to persist after death. Operation: Cinder was supposed to complete the ritual and allow his return, but because it was never fully carried out, he couldn’t. It would be another thirty years before an act of sufficient mass murder would come along to fully revitalize him.

reblog.comment:

blog.title: Star Wars AO3 Feed
blog.description:
An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

title: I’m Ready
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2KI0UlA

by Minkel23

She starts to unwrap her bindings, exposing inch after inch of creamy skin, and she hears Ben’s breath hitch in his throat.

‘Do you like looking at me?’ She asks, and he nods.

‘I shouldn’t,’ he says throatily.

‘I like you looking at me, like this,’ she replies, as she drops the final wrap from her chest.

‘You shouldn’t,’ he warns her. ‘Good Jedi’s don’t-’

‘Perhaps I’m not a very good Jedi,’ Rey replies.

He opens his arms and she lays between them.

‘The Rise of Skywalker’ inspired ficlet, in which Rey and Ben are left alone on Tatooine to train.

And some other things.

Words: 2676, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Prequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Rey (Star Wars), Ben Solo, Kylo Ren
  • Relationships: Rey/Ben Solo, Kylo Ren/Rey, Rey & Ben Solo | Kylo Ren
  • Additional Tags: The Rise of Skywalker inspired ficlet, Teaser Trailer thoughts, canonverse, Tatooine, kylo trains rey, plus some kissing, they aren’t very good Jedi’s


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2KI0UlA

blog.name: haruspis
blog.title: pursuing narrative truth & reconciliation
blog.description: | Alex | 24 | Cares and writes far too much about fictional universes.

tags: felt like it was pertinent to bring this up again
summary: Star Wars IX Needs its Forgotten Skywalker (or, ‘Why Shmi Skywalker Deserves Better’)
title: Star Wars IX Needs its Forgotten Skywalker (or, ‘Why Shmi Skywalker Deserves Better’)
description:
A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away….

A Queen in-disguise, a Jedi Knight, a heroic droid, and a hapless Gungan fled to a desert planet under the light of twin suns in search of a way to repair their starship, where they happened upon a slave boy with a great and terrible destiny.

Befriending these strangers, he took them to his home and gave them shelter from a storm, where they met the boy’s mother. She, too, was a slave, and had come from nothing, and had no great destiny to fulfil beyond the breaking of her heart in order to see her boy find his place in a galaxy that would never know her name.

A kindly farmer fell in love with her and freed her from her chains, and she knew happiness for a time; but still there remained a deep and empty hole in her heart as she looked to the sky and thought of the great deeds her son – who must have grown to be so strong and wise and kind – would be doing as he walked among the stars.

While she was happy with her new life and loved her newfound family, she hoped that, one day, she would feel the warmth of her son’s hand in hers again – even if she had to wait until her last breath left her body under the setting suns.

Her name was Shmi.

The first Skywalker.
